instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Brain dead
threads.message:
Wouldnt turn on liquid damage on <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> so i replaced it. Got fan spin and power consumption is normal thought it was all good until i put in to body, No display not chime no activity on usb no pram reset.
<CHIP>U1900</CHIP> was from a 2015 model donor board but this board is 2017 markings are different but i assume they are the same and wouldn't cause this issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Brain dead
threads.message:
"it was all good until i put in to body"
Did you get USB activity with the board alone on the desk?

If board turns on, <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> should be good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Brain dead
threads.message:
No I thought it was working due to the normal power consumption .
No corrosion was on the bios but will try clean ME region and new bios .
